contentItemData.description: Reviews using this XML-based mark-up language to describe the Bluetooth GATT database, configure access and security properties, and include the GATT database as part of the firmware.

contentItemData.label: UG365: GATT Configurator User's Guide
contentItemData.description: Describes how to use the GATT Configurator, an intuitive interface providing access to all the Profiles, Services, Characteristics, and Descriptors as defined in the Bluetooth specification.

contentItemData.description: Details implementing the Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader for EFR32 SoCs and NCPs with Silicon Labs wireless protocol stacks.

contentItemData.label: UG162: Simplicity Commander Reference Guide
contentItemData.description: Describes using Simplicity Commander's Command-Line Interface to configure and flash applications, and create binary images of them.

contentItemData.label: UG103.14: Bluetooth LE Fundamentals
contentItemData.description: Offers an overview for those new to the Bluetooth low energy technology.

contentItemData.label: UG103.6: Bootloader Fundamentals
contentItemData.description: Introduces bootloading for Silicon Labs networking devices.

contentItemData.label: UG103.7: Non-Volatile Data Storage Fundamentals
contentItemData.description: Introduces non-volatile data storage using flash and the three different storage implementations offered for Silicon Labs microcontrollers and SoCs: Simulated EEPROM, PS Store, and NVM3.

contentItemData.label: UG103.16: Multiprotocol Fundamentals
contentItemData.description: Described the four multiprotocol modes, discusses considerations when selecting protocols for multiprotocol implementations, and reviews the Radio Scheduler, a required component of a dynamic multiprotocol solution.

contentItemData.label: AN1086: Using the Gecko Bootloader with the Silicon Labs Bluetooth Applications
contentItemData.description: Includes detailed information on using the Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader with Silicon Labs Bluetooth applications. It supplements the general Gecko Bootloader implementation information provided in UG266: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User's Guide.

contentItemData.label: AN1135: Using Third Generation Non-Volatile Memory (NVM3) Data Storage
contentItemData.description: Explains how NVM3 can be used as non-volatile data storage in various protocol implementations.

contentItemData.label: AN1114: Integrating Silicon Labs Bluetooth Applications with the Micrium RTOS
contentItemData.description: Describes how to integrate a Silicon Labs Bluetooth application with an RTOS, using the Thermometer example as an illustration.

contentItemData.label: AN971: EFR32 Radio Configurator Guide
contentItemData.description: Describes the radio configurator GUI for RAIL framework applications. With it, you can create standard or custom radio configurations on which to run your RAIL-based applications. The role of each GUI item is explained.

contentItemData.label: AN1134: Dynamic Multiprotocol Development with Bluetooth and Proprietary Protocols on RAIL
contentItemData.description: Provides details on how to develop a dynamic multiprotocol application running Bluetooth and a proprietary protocol on RAIL.

contentItemData.label: AN1128: Bluetooth Coexistence with Wi-Fi
contentItemData.description: Describes the Wi-Fi impact on Bluetooth and methods to improve Bluetooth coexistence with Wi-Fi. Explains design considerations to improve coexistence without direct interaction between Bluetooth and Wi-Fi radios. These techniques are applicable to the Silicon Labs Mighty Gecko (EFR32MGx series) and Blue Gecko (EFR32BGx series). Discusses the Silicon Labs Packet Traffic Arbitration (PTA) support to coordinate 2.4GHz RF traffic for co-located Bluetooth and Wi-Fi radios.

contentItemData.label: Bluetooth Software API Reference Manual
contentItemData.description: Describes commands, events, enumerations and error codes in the Bluetooth stack and SDK.
